result.execSummary:
The defendant Ledoshia Vadea Glenora Oliver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Green County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: May be served under the Huber Law as long as the defendant reports and remains alcohol and controlled substance free.

All costs waived except for DNA surcharge.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by calling the Green County Jail Office at (608) 328-9598 WITHIN 72 HOURS OF SENTENCING to set up an appointment.  The Jail Office hours are 8 a.m. - 4 p.m. Monday - Friday.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the Judgment of Conviction documenting a DNA Surcharge.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats. 946.52
